title: Learn Hamlet in one easy session!
content:
You people are a bunch of unclutured rednecks! [But I forgive you.] But help is at hand! With this easy plot summary of Hamlet, one of Shakespears bloodiest [and therefore most cultured] plays, you too can start your way toward a more informed, cultured you. [It didn't work for me obviously, but you guys are normal.]

Hamlet, the consise version:

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/smallham.gif[/img]A proud member of the signature stealing society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/Kazz.gif[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Learn Hamlet in one easy session!
content: I don't really understand why people think Shakespeare's work is good. In my humble opinion it sucks. Thanks heaven we don't have to study his works here.You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: Learn Hamlet in one easy session!
content:
I think it leaves something to be desired when merely read, but the plays, when performed well, are pretty good.________________
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v462/lemur821/YorpEye.png[/img]

title: heh
content: This reminds me of a Romeo and Juliet done entirely (and very briefly) in l337sp34k and AOL'er language.  It was pretty entertaining, but not quite so accurate as this.  Wish I knew a link for it...

title: Re: heh
content:
Shakespeare's plays were groundbreaking for the time. If you read them, you are (or at least I was) astonished by all the clichs - until I realized they weren't clichs back when he wrote them.________

@_

title: Re: heh
content:
